questions.question_text:
Your company uses Teams.

A user reports that when they manually decline a Teams call, the call is NOT sent to their Teams voicemail.

Which setting should you configure?

choices.A: Busy on busy when in a call

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The "Calls ring me" option was part of older Teams settings, but in newer versions, Microsoft has changed the wording. Instead of "Calls ring me," you now have settings under Call handling and forwarding that control how calls behave.

Also,
Busy on busy during calls lets you configure how incoming calls are handled when a user is already in a call or conference or has a call placed on hold. New or incoming calls can be rejected with a busy signal or can be routed accordingly to the user's unanswered settings.

But in question, User manually decline a Teams call, not it get declined automatically by the status of user.

So Ans is Call Forwarding

To ensure that a manually declined Teams call is sent to the user's Teams voicemail, you need to configure the "Forward my calls" setting. This setting allows you to specify where calls should be forwarded when they are not answered, including sending them directly to voicemail.
Correct Answer:

C. Forward my calls

Selected Answer: D
It must be Answer: D because Answer: A is only for users how are already in a call, the question was only for manuall desicions

Selected Answer: D
Call me Ring.
By default in the Calling policies "Voicemail for Inbound calls" "Busy and Busy..." are set in "Let user decide"
So for redirect to Voicemail, you must using "Calls ring me" settings in Teams Client's Settings

comments.content: i think your right... because it says when "they manually decline a Teams call" The default setting of the calling policy is Let users decide... one of those vague MS questions. Both are technically right, but you have to make so many assumptions

discussion.content:
It seems like it depends on "D. Calls ring me" when "A. Busy on busy when in a call" is set with "Use unanswered settings." 

In that case, "If unanswered" is set as
do nothing -> call ends
voice mail -> voice mail runs

Selected Answer: A
Answer: A
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-calling-policy

Busy on busy during calls (also called "busy options") lets you configure how incoming calls are handled when a user is already in a call or conference or has a call placed on hold. New or incoming calls can be rejected with a busy signal or can be routed accordingly to the user's unanswered settings.

questions.question_text:
Your company uses Teams.

You plan to deploy Teams to a branch office that has limited bandwidth.

Which two features can be used when the Teams client has a bandwidth restriction of 150 kilobit/s up and 150 kilobit/s down? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/prepare-network#bandwidth-requirements

One to One video has a min requirement of 150 kilobit up/down
Audio meeting has a min requirement of 10 kilobit up/down
I think the questions reads which two features CAN'T be used with a limit of 150/150. That would make the answers correct. It may be a misspelling.

Selected Answer: BD
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/prepare-network#bandwidth-requirements

one-to-one screen sharing: 200/200
one-to-one video: 150/150
screen sharing during meetings: 250/250
audio during meetings: 10/10
video during meetings: 150/200

Selected Answer: BD
Screen shared during meeting: 250/250

Selected Answer: B
B - Teams Premium
Users already are assigned with M365 E5 

All needet features here are part of Teams Premium License:

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/enhanced-teams-experience#protected-meetings

Selected Answer: B
Sensitivity labels are available as part of the preview release of Teams Premium, an add-on license that provides additional features to make Teams meetings more personalized, intelligent, and secure.

Selected Answer: B
https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/sensitivity-labels-for-teams-meetings-2b244d1d-72d0-471e-8e58-c41079e190fb#:~:text=Sensitivity%20labels%20are%20available%20as,Premium%2C%20contact%20your%20IT%20admin.
Compliance is where you configure Sensitivity labels for Teams meetings
Teams Premium is the add-on license you need to have the ability to configure it.

questions.question_text:
Your company uses Teams.

All users are assigned a Microsoft 365 E5 license.

You need to purchase an add-on license that will enable the users to apply a sensitivity label to control the end-to-end encryption of highly sensitive Teams meetings.

Which add-on license should you purchase?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Note: If you don't see any options for simultaneous ring in your settings, it's likely you don't have an Enterprise Voice or Business Voice license. Also note that it can take up to 24 hours for changes in licenses to take effect.

From https://support.microsoft.com/en-gb/office/call-forwarding-call-groups-and-simultaneous-ring-in-microsoft-teams-a88da9e8-1343-4d3c-9bda-4b9615e4183e

Selected Answer: B
Note: If you don't see any options for call forwarding in your settings, it's likely that you don't have an Enterprise Voice or Business Voice license. Also note that it can take up to 24 hours for changes in licenses to take effect.

Probably the question indicates that forwarding options have to appear as seen in the below. 

https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/call-forwarding-call-groups-and-simultaneous-ring-in-microsoft-teams-a88da9e8-1343-4d3c-9bda-4b9615e4183e

Then B.Enterprise voice should be the answer.

comments.content:
From your link, the is a note as below.

Note: If you don't see any options for call forwarding in your settings, it's likely that you don't have an Enterprise Voice or Business Voice license.

Since we can see the call forwarding (as shown in teh screenshot), this means the Enterprise Voice license is already there. So it can't be B!

I would prefer D is correct!

discussion.content:
D - also check the picture that is been provided on the exhibit. go check forward my call options 
https://support.microsoft.com/en-gb/office/call-forwarding-call-groups-and-simultaneous-ring-in-microsoft-teams-a88da9e8-1343-4d3c-9bda-4b9615e4183e

D
Here's why:

Simultaneous ring: This feature allows users to receive incoming calls on multiple devices simultaneously. It also enables users to change the destination of forwarded calls by selecting a different device from the list of ringing devices.
Other options:
Busy on busy when in a call: This setting determines how incoming calls are handled when the user is already in a call. It doesn't affect the ability to change the destination of forwarded calls.
Enterprise Voice: This add-on license enables users to make and receive phone calls from Teams using traditional phone numbers. It doesn't directly impact the ability to change the destination of forwarded calls.
Outbound calling: This feature allows users to make calls to external phone numbers from Teams. It also doesn't affect the ability to change the destination of forwarded calls.

Selected Answer: B
To forward calls in Microsoft Teams, you typically need a Phone System license. Microsoft 365 E3 and E5 plans and provides the Phone System feature, allowing for call forwarding within Teams.
B is right

Selected Answer: A
The correct answer should be A 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-calling-policy

questions.question_text:
Your company uses Teams.

A user named User1 selects Forward my calls, and all incoming calls are forwarded to voicemail as shown in the following exhibit.

//IMG//


You need to ensure that User1 can change the destination of the forwarded calls.

What should you enable for User1?

choices.A: Busy on busy when in a call

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Watermark is only available if you have a Teams Premium license.

questions.question_text:
Case study -


Overview -


Company Information -

ADatum Corporation is an energy company that has offices across North America and 3,000 employees.


Physical Locations -

ADatum has the offices shown in the following table.

//IMG//



Existing Environment -


Network Infrastructure -

The office in Calgary has a 1-Gbps internet circuit. The offices in San Diego and New York have 100-Mbps internet circuits. The field site in Edmonton has a 3-Mbps internet circuit.


Departments -

ADatum has the following departments:

• Information technology (IT)
• Project management
• Marketing

Microsoft 365 and Tenants Environment

ADatum recently purchased a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that has the Microsoft Teams Domestic Calling Plan add-on. All users are assigned Microsoft 365 E5 and Microsoft Teams Domestic Calling Plan licenses and Calling Plans is deployed.

Azure AD has the default Cross-tenant access settings configured.

The Teams policies settings are configured as shown in the following exhibit.

//IMG//


The Teams client is deployed to a non-persistent Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI) used by the project management department.

Allow guest access in Teams is set to Off.

The Microsoft Viva Connections app is deployed to all users.


Problem Statements -

ADatum identifies the following issues:

• An executive at the San Diego office reports that video drops during Teams meetings.
• The Edmonton field site has limited bandwidth, and users report poor audio during Teams calls and meetings.
• Users in the project management department report that they cannot give or take control during Teams calls and meetings while sharing their VDI desktop.


Planned Changes -

ADatum plans to implement the following changes:

• Configure the media bit rate settings for the users at the Edmonton field site. The settings must apply only to the user while they are at the site, but NOT when they are at a different office.
• Create a Teams channel to enable the project management department to collaborate with the IT department on a device upgrade project.
• Implement a pilot rollout of Operator Connect for the users in the New York office. A port re-quest was accepted already.
• Create a Teams channel for the marketing department for external collaboration.
• Rename the Viva Connections icon as Start portal.


Technical Requirements -

ADatum identifies the following technical requirements:

• The marketing department requires that all the files shared by using Teams remain available for at least three years after deletion.
• The marketing department must be able to apply a watermark to content and video shared dur-ing Teams meetings.
• All users require indefinite access to training videos recorded in Teams by the IT department.
• All access to Teams and shared resources must use the principle of least privilege.
• Guest access must remain disabled.


Which license should you purchase to meet the technical requirements of the marketing department to apply a watermark?
